casebody.data:
The WESTERN CASUALTY AND SURETY COMPANY, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES FIDELITY & GUARANTY COMPANY, Appellee. No. 21216. United States Court of Appeals Fifth Circuit. Nov. 20, 1964. Rehearing Denied Dec. 21, 1964. Vardaman S. Dunn, Jackson, Miss., Cox, Dunn & Clark, Jackson, Miss., of counsel, for appellant. George H. Butler, Roger C. Landrum, Robert C. Cannada, Jackson, Miss., Butler, Snow, O’Mara, Stevens & Cannada, Jackson, Miss., of counsel, for appellee.

Before TUTTLE, Chief Judge, and JONES and ANDERSON* Circuit Judges.

Of the Second Circuit, sitting by designation.

 PER CURIAM.

Two insurance companies having the same risks invoke federal jurisdiction for a determination as to whether there shall be contribution between them in the payment of a loss. We are persuaded that the controversy was correctly decided by the district court, 235 F.Supp. 915, and its judgment is

Affirmed.
